comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Printed in error from a reversed negative.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: Found an article in El Paso Herald, issue February 14, 1911 (The Library of Congress, Cronicling America) entitled NAVARRO AND OROZCO BOTH NOW WAITING chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88084272/1911-02-14/ed-... , that mentions: "Orozco and his father are at Ochoa's Ranch, three miles from Samalayuca. The insurrecto forces are encamped in the hills west to Samalayuca... This was told by "Homar A. Scott, a photographer; John Sneed a special newspaper correspondent, and a party of El Pasoans [who] returned at 2:30 this morning from bellow Samalayuca..." Is it possible to link this picture to the photographer, the events and date mentioned above? And if you link to picture LC-B2-2377-5, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.10234 , it may be infered that the latter was taken at Ochoa´s Ranch when Villa was a colonel at the most and under Orozco Dr. Roberto Duarte Plastic Surgeon
